channel.title: Best mouse function
channel.description: Maby it doesn't matter that much, but what function is the best to use for clicking the mouse? Just clickmouse(x,y,true) or are there others i can better use?

item.title: Best mouse function
item.dc:creator: @cooldood92 cooldood92
item.description:
@cooldood92 wrote:

[quote=“Nashi, post:18, topic:122048”]I read the include, No offense to him it seems very sloppy, I think its made for Gaia(I dont know what that is)

And I dont know what Merit means >_<[/quote]

For the record you’re right. The RS section REALLY needs A LOT of work on it…It was originally for Gaia. Now it’s for any game requested to me. Planet Hell is my clan that was used on almost any game and we needed an include.

You could always use perfect mouse…going to be put into SCAR Divi 3.12 though.

Edit: BTW, I’m TheGuyWhoGotOn, I’m going to just make a new account…

Edit2:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:22, topic:122048”][quote author=Renax link=topic=171650.msg1633886#msg1633886 date=1185654421]
i have the strange feelingl my IQ dropped a significant amount after reading this thread…
[/quote]

That’s ridiculous. No IQ is negative.[/quote]

Lmao

item.title: Best mouse function
item.dc:creator: @Starblaster100 Starblaster100
item.description:
@Starblaster100 wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:19, topic:122048”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=171650.msg1592447#msg1592447 date=1184321225]
Jagex collects random mouse info every 50~ miliseconds, so if the mouse doesn’t get picked up with moving, the clicking will give it away. HOWEVER, I would really think there are simple checks to see if you can click a mouse without holding the mouse button down for more than 5(?)miliseconds.
[/quote]
As far as I can remember, it only stores the mouse location every 50 ms. From what I remember, data from every click has the potential to be saved, and then sent to the server if requested. So definitely click with caution.[/quote]

Yes I also thought this. However, ClickMouse and HoldMouse/Release mouse method send two different types of data to Jagex, and that is why they can tell the difference. Using clickMouse also makes the mouse move to the exact location you want to click unnaturally fast, and since they are tracking where your mouse is ever 50 ms, it looks a bit fishy

Read full topic

item.title: Best mouse function
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

The Un-Named:

Jagex collects random mouse info every 50~ miliseconds, so if the mouse doesn’t get picked up with moving, the clicking will give it away. HOWEVER, I would really think there are simple checks to see if you can click a mouse without holding the mouse button down for more than 5(?)miliseconds.

As far as I can remember, it only stores the mouse location every 50 ms. From what I remember, data from every click has the potential to be saved, and then sent to the server if requested. So definitely click with caution.

Read full topic

item.title: Best mouse function
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“Codester93, post:12, topic:122048”]use the include Osi.txt
it has mouse(x,y,true) i think thats how it is, well there one in Osi.txt that is human like that i used in my scripts that i keep to myself.
I used it for about 12 hours total, atleast, and i didnt get banned yet, so check into Osi.txt and the mouse procedure, I HIGHLY RECAMEND USING IT IN ALL RUNESCAPE SCRIPTS, its perfect.

like here an example
mouse(284, 295, 1, 1, true) the true can be changed to false if you want to right click
and i forget wat the 1 and 1 are for, and im to lazy to look into it, because i dont really make much scripts that involve that kind of clicking, so if someone else could tell him wat those two 1’s are for, i think he’ll appreciate it.
thanx(hope this helped you)[/quote]

No. Use the include SRL.

Read full topic

item.title: Best mouse function
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:9, topic:122048”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=171650.msg1592447#msg1592447 date=1184321225]
Jagex collects random mouse info every 50~ miliseconds, so if the mouse doesn’t get picked up with moving, the clicking will give it away. HOWEVER, I would really think there are simple checks to see if you can click a mouse without holding the mouse button down for more than 5(?)miliseconds.
[/quote]

Yea, but doing it within Scar is a problem unless you give it High prioirity and make sure it uses every cycle to check whether your mouse is down. The last time I tried it, I got roughly 100 ms to 200 ms. However I doubt the accuracy of this test. And I forgot that ClickMouse had a built-in timer. In that case, I wouldn’t use it for RS. I’d use GetMousePos(x,y) -> HoldMouse(x,y) -> Wait(100) + Rand(200) -> ReleaseMouse (x, y).[/quote]

I’m not quite sure what you mean, however I did use GhostMouse back in 2005 for 13 hours straight, so if you want to see if ClickMouse in 1 spot is detectable, you should try it on a new account. However, I SERIOUSLY advise to NOT use it when you can use Mouse(…).

Read full topic

item.title: Best mouse function
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

The Un-Named:

Jagex collects random mouse info every 50~ miliseconds, so if the mouse doesn’t get picked up with moving, the clicking will give it away. HOWEVER, I would really think there are simple checks to see if you can click a mouse without holding the mouse button down for more than 5(?)miliseconds.

Yea, but doing it within Scar is a problem unless you give it High prioirity and make sure it uses every cycle to check whether your mouse is down. The last time I tried it, I got roughly 100 ms to 200 ms. However I doubt the accuracy of this test. And I forgot that ClickMouse had a built-in timer. In that case, I wouldn’t use it for RS. I’d use GetMousePos(x,y) -> HoldMouse(x,y) -> Wait(100) + Rand(200) -> ReleaseMouse (x, y).

Read full topic

item.title: Best mouse function
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:6, topic:122048”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=171650.msg1592214#msg1592214 date=1184315893]
YES! THERE IS A DIFFERENCE! CLICKMOUSE WILL GET YOU BANNED ON 90% OF THE TIME YOU USE IT!
[/quote]

What about if you don’t change the cursor position?[/quote]

Jagex collects random mouse info every 50~ miliseconds, so if the mouse doesn’t get picked up with moving, the clicking will give it away. HOWEVER, I would really think there are simple checks to see if you can click a mouse without holding the mouse button down for more than 5(?)miliseconds.

Read full topic

item.title: Best mouse function
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:5, topic:122048”][quote author=IP-Drowner link=topic=171650.msg1589044#msg1589044 date=1184235023]

Maby it doesn’t matter that much, but what function is the best to use for clicking the mouse? Just clickmouse(x,y,true) or are there others i can better use?

There is one in SRL but i cannot remember that function. I would just use ClickMouse(x,y,True); anyways, as there really is no difference.
[/quote]

YES! THERE IS A DIFFERENCE! CLICKMOUSE WILL GET YOU BANNED ON 90% OF THE TIME YOU USE IT![/quote]

I know there is a difference and that is why i do not use ClickMouse in Runescape. Other games i do though.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Best mouse function
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

omg omg omg:

The SRL function is mouse(x, y, (randomx), (randomy), true);. this moves the mouse slowly to a random spot in the location you choose. mmouse(x, y, (randomx), (randomy),); only moves the mouse, but doesn’t click.

Good answer. An example would be:

Mouse(500, 600, 4, 4, true);

Read full topic

item.description:
